physical_examinations.relevant_findings: 79-year-old woman had normal hypercoagulability workup. Repeat venous ultrasound examination showed recanalization of right popliteal and calf veins.
24-year-old woman presented with painful, swollen right leg and persistent shortness of breath. Diagnosed with right iliofemoral vein thrombosis and pulmonary embolism.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Initially, she was anticoagulated for 14 months and later treated with enoxaparin as a bridge to warfarin after imaging showed acute right common femoral vein thrombosis.
